definition[0]: a short flight made by a plane over enemy land, in order to bomb a city, military defences etc
example[0]: The US and its allies carried out 44,000 sorties during this period.
definition[1]: a short trip, especially to an unfamiliar place
example[1]: We made a sortie from our hotel to the open-air market.
definition[2]: an attempt to do or take part in something new
example[2]: Australiaâ€™s first sortie into the wine trade
definition[3]: an attack in which an army leaves its position for a short time to attack the enemy
definition[4]: to make a short attack on an enemy position or a flight over enemy land
example[3]: It was five months since the battleship had last sortied from home waters.
